attributes.additional_details:
The Dalston Peace Mural not only represents an era past but also represents the present. Completed 28 years ago, reminds us of peace, unity and love amongst a community, not a typically affluent area but one of which the community is most important.
Most recently, Atlantic Records artists and local Hackney band Rudimental used the mural on their #1 Gold-selling album ‘Home’ taking this local mural worldwide and putting Dalston and Hackney on the map.
Dalston Peace Mural represents a neighbourhood, a home, childhood, adulthood – a constant reminder of where they came from and where they want to go. This is a landmark that is treasured by so many and deserves to be kept standing – it has a voice and a heart – this isn’t some ugly and faceless graffiti – its home.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the Local Authority.
